articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Trump administration cancels $400M in grants and contracts with Columbia University
articles.description: The Trump administration says it’s pulling $400 million from Columbia University. Multiple federal agencies announced Friday that they're canceling grants and contracts because of what the government describes as the Ivy League school’s lackluster efforts to squelch antisemitism on campus.
articles.content:
▶ Follow live updates on President Donald Trump and his new administration.
NEW YORK (AP) — The Trump administration said Friday that it’s pulling $400 million from Columbia University, canceling grants and contracts because of what the government de... [5159 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: A Firing Squad's Return: South Carolina's First Execution in 15 Years
articles.description: South Carolina plans its first firing squad execution in 15 years for Brad Sigmon, who prefers this method over alternatives. Several Democrat-led states challenge Trump's mass federal employee firings. Additionally, Gene Hackman passes due to heart disease, and the U.S. set to end collective bargaining for TSA officers.
articles.content: In a controversial move, South Carolina is set to execute Brad Sigmon via firing squad, marking the first such execution in the United States in 15 years. Sigmon, convicted of two murders, opted for this method due to concerns over the other executio... [701 chars]

articles.title: US reviewing visa programs as official says Afghanistan could be included in Trump travel ban
articles.description: The US State Department is “undertaking a full review of all visa programs,” a department spokesperson confirmed amid reports of an impending new travel ban, and a US official familiar with the situation told CNN that Afghanistan could be among the countries included.
articles.content:

articles.title: Rubio takes flak for Trump admin's Russia stance, a sharp contrast from his hawkish history
articles.description: The Trump administration has made overtures to a country that Rubio has railed against during most of his career, especially in relation to Russia's backing of countries like Cuba.
articles.content: MIAMI — President Donald Trump’s threats of tariffs and sanctions to Russia as leverage to negotiate a ceasefire with Ukraine may be a welcome pivot that draws some attention away from the administration’s recent support for Russian President Vladimi... [5695 chars]

articles.title: Trump administration throws hundreds of affordable housing projects into limbo after contract cuts
articles.description: The Associated Press has found that the Trump administration has stalled at least $60 million in funding intended largely for affordable housing developments nationwide.

articles.title: Trump will lead task force preparing for 2026 World Cup
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump created a task force Friday to prepare for the 2026 World Cup, which will bring the globe’s premier soccer tournament to North America at a time when his on-again, off-again tariffs have ratcheted up tensions across the continent.

articles.title: How Much the Guests at Trump’s Crypto Summit Donated to His Inauguration
articles.description: The list of invitees at the White House crypto summit illustrates the tight link between Trump and new cohort of political donors.
articles.content:
The cryptocurrency investors and executives who crowded into the White House for a summit with Donald Trump on Friday represented billions in net worth.

articles.title: Misri holds talks with Russian counterpart Rudenko in Moscow
articles.description: The foreign secretary's visit is taking place amid a renewed focus on the Ukraine conflict after US President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy traded verbal blows at the Oval Office in the White House on Friday last that drew global attention.
articles.content:
